TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MulticastOption extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains values used to join and drop multicast groups.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use a <xref:System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOption> to store the <xref:System.Net.IPAddress> of a multicast group you want to join or drop. Use the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.SetSocketOption%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method with the following parameters to join a multicast group.
|Parameter|Value| |---------------|-----------| |socketOptionLevel|<xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionLevel.Udp?displayProperty=nameWithType>| |socketOptionName|<xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName.AddMembership>| |object|<xref:System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOption>|
Use <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName.DropMembership> to drop a multicast group.
## Examples The following examples join the default IP interface to an IP multicast group. They assume the IP multicast group address in the range 224.0.0.0 to 239.255.255.255.
:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionListener/CPP/listener.cpp" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionListener/CS/listener.cs" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionListener/VB/listener.vb" id="Snippet1":::
:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionSender/CPP/sender.cpp" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionSender/CS/sender.cs" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionSender/VB/sender.vb" id="Snippet1":::

Docs.summary: Initializes a new version of the class for the specified IP multicast group.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For machines with multiple network cards, do not use this constructor. Use the constructor that takes a group and a local IP address.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified IP multicast group address and local IP address associated with a network interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For machines with multiple network cards, you must use this constructor to create <xref:System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOption> instances.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOption> object.
:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionListener/CPP/listener.cpp" id="Snippet2"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionListener/CS/listener.cs" id="Snippet2"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionListener/VB/listener.vb" id="Snippet2":::

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the IP address of a multicast group.
Docs.value: The IP address of a multicast group.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Valid IP addresses for multicast packets are in the range 224.0.0.0 to 239.255.255.255.
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.
:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionListener/CPP/listener.cpp" id="Snippet3"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionListener/CS/listener.cs" id="Snippet3"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionListener/VB/listener.vb" id="Snippet3":::

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the local address associated with a multicast group.
Docs.value: The local address associated with a multicast group.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOption.LocalAddress%2A> property contains the IP address of the interface associated with the multicast group membership. If <xref:System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOption.LocalAddress%2A> is set to <xref:System.Net.IPAddress.Any>, the default interface is used.
## Examples The following example displays the value of this property.
:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionListener/CPP/listener.cpp" id="Snippet3"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionListener/CS/listener.cs" id="Snippet3"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOptionListener/VB/listener.vb" id="Snippet3":::
